title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Daytona Beach

content.rendered:
Daytona Beach is located in Volusia County, Florida. Also, it’s a principal city of the Deltona–Daytona Beach–Ormond Beach metropolitan area. Historically known for its hard-packed sand beaches and motorsports, it attracts vacationers from all over the world. Furthermore, the hard-packed sand makes Daytona Beach perfect for racing. Hence, it is known as the “World Center of Racing” and is home to the headquarters of NASCAR. If you’re finding rooms for rent in Daytona Beach, discover more about the city and its best neighborhoods.

Related: Roomi’s Guide To Working With Small Spaces & Studio Apartments

Getting to know Daytona Beach

The Daytona Beach area was originally home to the indigenous Timucuan Indians, who lived in fortified villages. Later home to the Orange Grove Plantation, it was bought by Mathias Day Jr. in 1871. There, he established a hotel, around which the town grew. However, Day lost the deed to the land after running into financial trouble. But locals still named the town Daytona in his honor.

Daytona Beach has a humid subtropical climate, with two major seasons. Hence, there is the warmer, wetter season (May-October) and the cooler and drier season (November-April). While the weather is mostly stable, there can be occasional adversities. Therefore, watch out for tropical storms or hurricanes if you are looking for rooms for rent in Daytona Beach.

Finding rooms for rent in Daytona Beach

Find A Room For Rent In Daytona Beach, FL

Daytona Beach is split into two by the Halifax River lagoon, part of the Intracoastal Waterway. Furthermore, it is bordered on the north by Holly Hill and Ormond Beach, and on the south by Daytona Beach Shores, South Daytona, and Port Orange. The city also has an area of 68.17 sq. mi. and a population of around 69,186.

Related: Questions You Need To Ask Your Potential Roommate Before Saying Yes

Top neighborhoods in Daytona Beach

  • Downtown: Downtown is a great place to find rooms for rent in Daytona Beach to be close to everything. With a nice mix of shopping, dining, and entertainment options, the area is lively and well-connected to other parts of the city. Moreover, being the cultural center of Daytona Beach, it has plenty to explore on foot.
  • Daytona Beach Shores: Still close to central Daytona Beach, this area offers a more relaxed and quiet environment. If you are finding cheap rooms for rent in Daytona Beach and want to get away from the tourists but still be close to the heart of the city, this is perfect. Furthermore, this area offers scenic views and access to beautiful beaches.
  • East Daytona: This neighborhood is a great place to find rooms for rent in Daytona if you want to be close to the beaches and activities. Home to several eateries, bars, restaurants, and even resorts, the area is constantly busy. However, East Daytona can be expensive compared to the average rent in Daytona Beach.

Related: How to Manage Finances When You Share an Apartment

Average rent in Daytona Beach

Related: Decorating Your Off-Campus Housing Or Apartment On A Budget

University life in Daytona Beach

Daytona Beach can be a great place to study if you enjoy lively city life and want the bonus of being close to the beach. Moreover, the city has great options for colleges and is known for its higher education and attracting students. Here are the living costs and some of the best colleges in Daytona Beach.

Average cost of living in Daytona Beach

Related: Tips On How To Save Money For Everyone

Top universities in Daytona Beach:

  • Embry–Riddle Aeronautical University
  • The College of Medicine Florida State University
  • University of Central Florida, Daytona Beach Campus
  • Daytona State College
  • Bethune–Cookman University

How transit friendly is Daytona Beach?

1. Airports

Daytona Beach has passenger airline services located at the Daytona Beach International Airport (DAB). American Airlines and Delta Airlines offer flights to the city with non-stop service to Charlotte and Atlanta. However, keep in mind that options are limited if you are flying into Daytona Beach. If you are flying in to find cheap rooms for rent in Daytona Beach, Orlando International Airport and Jacksonville International Airport have more flight options.

2. Taxis

Taxis in Daytona Beach are generally safe, and cheaper when compared to other cities. However, you may run into difficulties finding one in certain places or late at night. Hence, it makes sense to book one in advance. Ride-sharing apps like Uber and Lyft are also available, which can be handy if you are looking for cheap rooms for rent in Daytona Beach in an out-of-the-way area.

3. Buses

Greyhound buses are a great option if you want to reach Daytona Beach by bus and have regular service to the city. Buses in the city are operated by the Volusia County Public Transit System (Votran). It runs fixed-route buses as well as paratransit services throughout the entire county. Single rides are $1.75 per trip and a 24-hour pass costs $3.75. Hence, it’s a great way to get around the city if you are finding rooms for rent in Daytona Beach.

4. Railways

With the passenger railway being set up in Daytona Beach in 1889, it remains a great way to get to the city. Amtrak offers regular passenger service with the closest stop being near DeLand. However, a Thruway Motorcoach connection between the beachside and Amtrak’s DeLand Station connects the two cities.

Cultural activities in Daytona Beach

  • Daytona International Speedway: This speedway has a capacity of 168,000 spectators and hosts motor vehicle races of various kinds. However, most notably, it hosts the Daytona 500, which is also called ‘The Great American Race.’ Additionally, it is also home to a historical museum, racing simulators, pit stop demonstrations, and more. Thus, this is a must-visit if you are a racing fan and are finding rooms for rent in Daytona Beach.
  • Museum of Arts and Sciences: The Museum of Arts and Sciences hosts both traveling exhibitions and a permanent collection. Furthermore, the galleries feature Chinese, African and Cuban art. Additionally, a planetarium is also on-site with laser concerts and educational shows. Hence, it is a great place to explore if you are finding rooms for rent in Daytona Beach.
  • Daytona Beach Flea Market: The Daytona Beach Flea Market opens on weekends with stalls that sell anything you could want. For example, jewelry, produce, clothing, toys, and electronics are all available here. One of the largest and most highly rated flea markets in the country, it is a must-see if you are finding rooms for rent in Daytona Beach.

Related: Fun Ideas For a Night In With Your Roommates

Dining in Daytona Beach

  • Zen Bistro: This warm, family-owned Thai joint has great dishes, an outdoor patio, a bar, and a fire pit. Surrounded by a variety of luscious bamboo trees, it has a unique ambiance and authentic Thai food. With spiced-to-order dishes and a variety of options, this place is a favorite with locals and visitors alike.
  • Rossellini’s Restaurant & Lounge: This oceanside upscale Italian joint has stylish indoor/outdoor seating with weekend live music and great views. With a variety of renowned pasta, pizzas, salads, desserts, and wines, this place is worth the hype.
  • Molly Hatchet’s Subs: This joint is a great budget option if you are hungry for a quick snack. Furthermore, it offers a no-frills experience with a compact seating area. The subs are a favorite among locals, who swear by them. However, if you want something else, their menu offers variety too.

Related: 7 Easy & Healthy Prepared Meal Ideas With Low Carbs

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Daytona Beach? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we’ll help you find your perfect match!

FIND ROOMMATES
DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
